channel.title: CRIB on CRIB artemis
channel.description: Recent content in CRIB on CRIB artemis

item.title: New experiment
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-05 by Kodai Okawa If you installed with “curl” command explained previous chapter, you should have artnew command.

item.title: Online-mode analysis
item.description: last modified: 2023-12-12 by Kodai Okawa We often use “nssta” (non-save mode start) analysis in the beam tuning.

item.title: New user
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-05 by Kodai Okawa After artnew command, you can see new directory of config files.

item.title: User config
item.description: last modified: 2024-01-20 by Kodai Okawa Warning still under consideration in this part!

item.title: Build
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-14 by Kodai Okawa Before starting analysis, you need to build.

item.title: New commands
item.description: last modified: 2024-01-20 by Kodai Okawa Various commands (mainly the same with ANAPAW commands) have been developed for CRIB experiment.

item.title: Map configuration
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-14 by Kodai Okawa From this section, we start to configure the settings according to the actual experimental setup.

item.title: artemis
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa From the current situation, CRIB experiment doesn’t use GET system, so we describe how to install it without linking it to GET decoder.

item.title: mount setting
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa For the convinience, we use one directory to store raw data (ridf files) and make symbolic link to each user work directory.

item.title: energyloss calculator
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-05 by Kodai Okawa Some CRIB-specific files use energy loss libraries.

item.title: art_analysis
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-14 by Kodai Okawa With this command, all initial settings of “art_analysis” are made.

item.title: Minor changes
item.description: last modified: 2024-01-11 by Kodai Okawa thisartemis.sh.in Grammar issue I think.
